    • Constructor Detail

      • KahinaControlAgent

        public KahinaControlAgent(LogicProgrammingInstance<?,?,?,?> kahina)
        Class constructor for control points. An actuator must be set before the control point can be used.

        The breakpoint starts out with the following default values:
        name - "Breakpoint " + a number
        signalColor - a random RGB color
        active - true (= activated)
        pattern - the empty pattern

        Parameters:
        a - backpointer to the relevant KahinaController

        the name of the control point

      • setName

        public void setName(java.lang.String name)
        Sets the name of the control point that will be used by various GUI components.
        Parameters:
        name - a user-readable name for this control point

      • isActive

        public boolean isActive()
        Checks whether this control point is active. Used by tree automata to decide whether to inform Kahina about matches.
        Returns:
        true if this control point is active, false if it is inactive

      • activate

        public void activate()
        Activates this control point, causing the messaging system to announce its matches.

      • deactivate

        public void deactivate()
        Deactivates this control point, preventing the messaging system from announcing its matches.

      • getSignalColor

        public java.awt.Color getSignalColor()
        Gets the signal color used for highlighting matches of this control point.
        Returns:
        the signal color associated with this control point

        Sets the signal color used for highlighting matches of this control point.
        Parameters:
        signalColor - the signal color to be associated with this control point

        public KahinaTree getStepTree()

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Returns the breakpoint's name, prefixed by '#' if it is inactive.
        Overrides:

        Generates an XML representation of this control point, optionally featuring an XML header.
        Parameters:

        Returns:

                           LogicProgrammingInstance<?,?,?,?> instance)
        Constructs a control point from an XML representation as produced by exportXML.
        Parameters:
        controlAgentNode - an XML DOM element with name "controlPoint" as produced when parsing the result of exportXML
        Returns:
        a new control point object corresponding to the XML representation contained in the DOM element
